Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz snuck behind the opponent’s defense in the 30th minute and gifted a goal to Deniz Undav
Maximilian Mittelstädt whipped in a beautiful cross to Undav to give Germany an insurmountable lead
Edin Džeko scored a header in the 70th minute
Pre-Game Insights: The squad was severely lacking in Bayern Munich players
Nübel earned his first international start
Jamal Musiala, Aleksandar Pavlović, and Leroy Sané all missed the match due to minor injuries
Post-Match Reflections: Džeko was largely ineffective but still knows how to score against elite opponents
Mittelstädt played extremely well as the left-back and consistently sent dangerous balls into the box
Andrich delivered a beautiful ball to Wirtz that led to the opening goal
Wirtz slipped through the backline and laid off an easy goal for Undav to give Germany the lead
Undav provided a healthy combination of brute physicality with spatial intuition
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bayern loanee Nübel earned his first international start
Germany used a quick passing attack to dominate possession and keep the Bosnians on their heels
